basicRead.description: Mandatory if readUType is set to basicRead

quality.description: The quality of the read taken.  If absent then assumed to be ACTUAL

value.description: Meter read value.  If positive then it means consumption, if negative it means export

controlledLoad.description: Indicates whether the energy recorded by this register is created under a Controlled Load regime

intervalRead.description: Mandatory if readUType is set to intervalRead

aggregateValue.description: The aggregate sum of the interval read values. If positive then it means net consumption, if negative it means net export

intervalReads.description: Array of reads with each element indicating the read for the interval specified by readIntervalLength beginning at midnight of readStartDate (for example 00:00 to 00:30 would be the first reading in a 30 minute Interval)

quality.description: The quality of the read taken.  If absent then assumed to be ACTUAL

value.description: Interval value.  If positive then it means consumption, if negative it means export

meterID.description: Meter id/serial number as it appears in customerâ€™s bill. ID permanence rules do not apply.

readEndDate.description: Date time when the meter reads end.  If absent then assumed to be equal to readStartDate.  In this case the entry represents data for a single date specified by readStartDate

readStartDate.description: Date time when the meter reads start

readUType.description: Specify the type of the meter read data

registerId.description: Register ID of the meter register where the meter reads are obtained

registerSuffix.description: Register suffix of the meter register where the meter reads are obtained

servicePointId.description: The independent ID of the service point, known in the industry as the National Meter Identifier (NMI). Note that the servicePointId will be replaced with NMI for all interactions between Data Holder and AEMO.

unitOfMeasure.description: Unit of measure of the meter reads. Refer to Appendix B of MDFF Specification NEM12 NEM13 v2.1 for a list of possible values
